When traded to the Hazhalm Testing Grounds' Entry Gate,  $���� will light and become  $����.1�
From that moment, the owner of the #���� will reserve and gain access to one of the facility's many chambers.1�
By using the #���� it will produce a replica of itself which can be given to another, granting him or her access to the same chamber.1�
Though an infinite number of lamps can be produced using this method, only a maximum of thirty-six people can venture into the same chamber.1�
These lamps will also cease to function the instant any adventurer within the chamber engages in battle, regardless of how many people have already passed through the gates.1�
To teleport to the reserved chamber, one must simply trade their #���� to the Entry Gate.1�
However, please note that not everyone in possession of a lamp will be allowed into Hazhalm.1�
As mentioned before, only up to thirty-six people may enter a chamber. Even those with a valid #���� will not be allowed entry if the chamber has reached its maximum capacity.1�
Also, as a safety precaution, players below level sixty and those with the Battlefield status in effect will be denied entry.1�

After visiting the testing grounds, one must wait 
 �[hour/hours] (Earth time) before he is granted access again.1�
This not only pertains to the chamber previously visited, but all areas within the testing grounds.1�
The amount of waiting time remaining before re-entry is permitted can be viewed by checking Hazhalm's Entry Gate.1�
All monsters dwelling in the testing grounds can be attacked by anyone, regardless of party or alliance.1�
In addition, any items dropped by a foe can be lotted on by anyone in the chamber.1�
However, please be aware that any items that have not been lotted on when a chamber's reservation is up will be distributed at random.1�

At any time, if the number of active adventurers participating in the cleansing of the testing grounds falls below six, the reservation will become void and any remaining members will be teleported from the area in approximately 
 �[minute/minutes] (Earth time).1�

Also, if everyone in a chamber remains KO'd for longer than 
 �[minute/minutes], they will all be automatically teleported from the grounds.1�

Oh my Gob! You're one of those adventurerurers, aren't ya?You got nothin' on me, �[man./lady.] I was just mindin' my own businesesess, lookin' for junk an' stuff.1�
Hey, watch out. You don't wanna fight me. I'll turn you into meat jerky!Wait, how about you and me be friends instead? Sound good?1�
I travel all over the world and hear lots of differererent stories. I even hear your stories. I can tell you one, if you want.1�
Do you want to hear a story?No, thank you.Let's hear one.1�

What story would you like to be told?On second thought, maybe later.Path of Blood(pt.1).Path of Blood(pt.2).The Rider Cometh(pt.1).The Rider Cometh(pt.2).Unwavering Resolve(pt.1).Unwavering Resolve(pt.2).Unwavering Resolve(pt.3).A Stygian Pact(pt.1).A Stygian Pact(pt.2).A Stygian Pact(pt.3).Ghatsad's Quandary.1�
Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.1�
This blaze is not of Urhguum.1�
If there were no illumination of this world present, this conflagration would completely escape your mortal gaze...1�
It is a flame of the underworld.1�
Oho.Why, it's not even hot...1�
Stay back!1�
The flame produces no heat, but it will scorch your soul, and consume your flesh...1�
Assuming a construct such as you had a soul...or flesh.1�
Great Odin!1�
Sovereign of darkness and battle, lord of the underworld!1�
Your humble servant Luzaf stands on the threshold of your domain.1�
Ah...didn't the Imperial Army seal off the entrance to the underworld?1�
The rules of time and space don't apply equally to this world and that, Miss.1�
By rights, this rent in the curtain between the two worlds, this...dimensional hiccup...shouldn't even exist.1�
No being, from either reality, has the art to mend such a fluke of fortune.1�
Throwing a bunch of laboratory nasties in the path of potential meddlers was about the best they could do.1�
Ain't that right, Boss?1�
Silence.1�
The manifestation begins...1�
Aaahhh!!!�
Aphmau!�
Are you harmed!?1�
Boss!1�
Forget the girl.Do you want Lord Odin to arrive without the warm welcome of his servant?1�
Flit!6You knew this would happen!1�
Great Odin, Lord of the Underworld!1�
I trust Your Malevolence is well?1�
Look lively, Boss!1�
In ages past, I oft journeyed the boundless aethyr to pay visit this emerald isle.1�
Who standeth before me? What doth bestir the soul of my knight from our nether abode?1�
Why, 'tis a fellow prisoner to the gaoler of fate.Rejoice, for tonight thy light hath guided me hither.1�
Reveal unto me the wishes of thy base mortal heart.Dost thou seek boundless riches? Eternal glory? Or wouldst thou walk a darker path?1�
It is the wont of mortals to desire.Those worthy of that which they covet are few.�
Serve bliss unto me with thy blade.If thy strength is true, thy plea shall be heard.1�
Excellent!Thou hast done well to entertain me for the nonce.1�
Thou hast proven thyself worthy of my boon.Speak unto me thy wish.1�
Thou wouldst see my knight unfettered?1�
Ahahahahahaha!!!Thou knowest not what folly thou speakest.1�
My knight is one with me, to wander the nether plains for all eternity.Thou shalt receive a reward to meet the measure of thy deeds...1�
Thy desire?� $����.� $����.� $����.Monetary riches.A pact with Odin.Information about Valhalla.1�
...That is thy true desire?1�
Accept  $����?Yes.On second thought...1�

Very well.Rejoice, for I grant unto thee thy desire.1�

Very well. 'Tis but a gleed in the vast sea of hellfire that is my power, but I grant unto thee my boon.1�
Accept a monetary reward?Yes.On second thought...1�
Very well.Rejoice, for I grant unto thee thy desire.1�
Is thy heart sated?1�
Nay, never shall it be, for boundless is the avarice of the sons of man.1�
For as long as thine heart dost harbour base desire, I shall stand here to meet thee.Now go thy ways!�
I am come.For as long as thy heart o'erbrims with base desire, I shall stand to meet thee.1�
Dost thou not see? Our fates are entwined, now and for all days.Do not resist. Let thy rage seethe forth!1�
To the victor go the spoils.If thou wouldst claim what thou desirest, stand now and face my blade!1�
Excellent!Thou hast done well to entertain me for the nonce.1�
Thou hast proven thyself worthy of my boon.Speak unto me thy wish.1�

Fool! Who art thou, to make such a brazen plea?1�
Thy covetous heart remains unsated?1�
Lay bare before me thy unfettered desire, that thou might claim what thou truly seekest.1�
Fool! Who art thou, to make such a brazen plea?1�
The fool who repeateth his words is but twice the fool.1�
Thou dost think to curry my favor, but I grow only wroth with thine obstinance.1�
Take thy reward and begone from this place.1�
Thy covetous heart remains unsated?1�
Lay bare before me thy unfettered desire, that thou might claim what thou truly seekest.1�
Doth a suckling infant speak demands unto a king? Doth a grain of sand gainsay the river?Thou knowest not thy place.1�
Still thou wouldst persist in this futile endeavor?1�
Thou art either bold or foolish, or mayhap the twain.Not unlike another I know...1�
It would seem thy fate remains to be writ.1�
Take thy reward and begone from this place.1�
Thy covetous heart remains unsated?1�
Lay bare before me thy unfettered desire, that thou might claim what thou truly seekest.1�
A thousand eternities might pass, then a thousand more, ere thou wouldst be worthy of that which thou dost now entreat.Reck ye now thine folly?1�
Yet, knowing this, thy desire burns still?1�
Take thy reward and begone from this place.1�

The shared memories of generations of mooglekind flood into your mind, granting you the ability to decipher the cryptic glyphs of your 3����...1�
Ah, it's you. I wasn't expecting to see you here.1�
According to the info I've m-m-managed to collect, a large rift in the space-time continuum lies deep within the ancient facility behind this door.1�
There, it is rum-m-mored that Odin, the god and ruler of Valhalla, will appear...1�
However, a powerful m-m-magical seal has been placed on this location.It will not be easy to meet with Odin.1�
By the way, do you rem-m-member what Amnaf the Immortal said at the stone tablet in the Caedarva Mire?1�
��There is a large-scale war brewing in Valhalla, land of the chosen souls...There is an open rebellion against Odin, the god who controls Valhalla.��1�
I'd like to know m-m-more about this war.Have you heard anything about it?1�
What do you know?Nothing really.Talk about Rishfee.Odin hasn't told me anything.1�
You're useless. M-m-maybe you just forgot?1�
Actually, I believe Amnaf m-m-mentioned pursuing Rishfee in Valhalla.1�
Who is this Rishfee? If he's an Immortal m-m-much like Amnaf, could he also have risen again?1�
I see! So there was another blue m-m-mage!1�
And he wished for the m-m-magical power within him to be absorbed by the Prison Orb...1�
Yes, I suppose that could allow you to have a m-m-meaningful conversation with him.1�
Do you m-m-mean to say you've actually met with Odin!?1�
That m-m-must mean there's a way to break through this seal. This could prove useful.1�
Hraaah!�
